Vegan General Tso’s Soy Curls

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here— https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-general-tsos-soy-curls/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Dry Soycurls Are marinated in the general Tso’s sauce then crisped up in the pan. This adds allot of flavor to the soycurls and crisping locks in the flavor and improves texture! 

Easy weeknight stir fry with soy curls and veggies. Vegan General Tso’s Chicken. Gluten-free, Nut-free.

This general tso’s Sauce + Soy Curls makes for an amazing weeknight meal. Soy curls are marinated in the from scratch homemade general tsos sauce mixture, then stir fried to crisp. Veggies added in along, and the rest of the marinade is then cooked down to thicken. Serve this easy stir fry with rice or noodles!

recipeIngredient: 4 oz soy curls ((dry), see notes for where to buy and sub options)
3 to 4 tbsp sugar or coconut sugar or other sweetener
1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce use tamari to make gluten-free
2 tsp sambal oelek chile paste optional or sriracha or pepper flakes to taste
1/4 cup chopped green onions (,white portions as well, use greens for garnish)
1 cup zuchini or carrots or other veggies

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the marinade. **Reserve 1/2 cup of the marinade in another bowl to use later. Add soy curls to the marinade and mix and soak for 10-15 mins. Toss twice in between so all soy curls marinate well.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the marinade. **Reserve 1/2 cup of the marinade in another bowl to use later. Add soy curls to the marinade and mix and soak for 10-15 mins. Toss twice in between so all soy curls marinate well.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add oil. When hot, add garlic and green onion and toss for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add oil. When hot, add garlic and green onion and toss for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Fish out the soy curls from the marinade and add to the pan, cook for 4 to 5 mins to brown some edges. (you can also toss the marinated soy curls in cornstarch before using for extra crispness). Add the peppers and veggies and mix. Add a pinch of salt and cook for 2 mins
recipeInstructions.name: Fish out the soy curls from the marinade and add to the pan, cook for 4 to 5 mins to brown some edges. (you can also toss the marinated soy curls in cornstarch before using for extra crispness). Add the peppers and veggies and mix. Add a pinch of salt and cook for 2 mins

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 tbsp cornstarch and 1/4 cup water to the remaining marinade (reserved plus remaining) and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 tbsp cornstarch and 1/4 cup water to the remaining marinade (reserved plus remaining) and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the marinade sauce mixture to the pan and mix. Cover and cook for 3 to 4 mins to thicken. Stir once in between. Also taste at the time to adjust flavor. Add salt, sugar, heat if needed. Let sit covered for another min.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the marinade sauce mixture to the pan and mix. Cover and cook for 3 to 4 mins to thicken. Stir once in between. Also taste at the time to adjust flavor. Add salt, sugar, heat if needed. Let sit covered for another min.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with rice and blanched broccoli. garnish with green onions , toasted sesame seeds, and fresh black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with rice and blanched broccoli. garnish with green onions , toasted sesame seeds, and fresh black pepper.
